message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.LG. 

The paper presents a visual analytics system for augmenting the manual annotation process of argumentation mining. The system incorporates linguistic knowledge and language modeling to learn a measure of argument similarity from user interactions. The paper also identifies and models five high-level analysis tasks. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The paper also involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques, which suggest the sub-categories cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also deals with information retrieval and graph exploration, which suggest the sub-categories cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.LG (Machine Learning).
